beak.utilities.eda module

beak.utilities.eda.get_outliers_zscore(data: DataFrame, column: str, threshold: number = 3.0) → DataFrame[source]

Get outliers based on the z-score using scikit-learn.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame.

  • column (str) – The column name to calculate z-scores and identify outliers.

  • threshold (np.number) – The threshold value for identifying outliers. Defaults to 3.0.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the outliers based on the z-score.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

beak.utilities.eda.get_outliers_iqr(data: DataFrame | ndarray, column: str | None = None, threshold: number = 1.5) → Series[source]

Get outliers based on the IQR method.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame.

  • column (str) – The column name to calculate outliers for.

  • threshold (np.number) – The threshold value for outlier detection. Defaults to 1.5.

Returns:

A Series containing the outliers.

Return type:

pd.Series

beak.utilities.eda.clip_outliers(data: DataFrame, columns: List[str], threshold: number = 1.5) → DataFrame[source]

Clip outliers in the specified columns of a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame.

  • columns (List[str]) – The list of column names to clip outliers.

  • threshold (np.number) – The threshold value for clipping outliers.

Returns:

The DataFrame with outliers clipped in the specified columns.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
